edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro

Class SimpleReplacementMacro

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro.Macro
      • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro.SimpleReplacementMacro

  • public abstract class SimpleReplacementMacro
extends Macro
    A Macro that just replaces each match with a replacement string. The replacement string is as described in Matcher.appendReplacement(StringBuffer, String).

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro.Macro

    • Method Detail

      • modify

        protected java.lang.String modify(java.lang.String code,
                      java.util.regex.MatchResult match)
        Description copied from class: Macro

        Subclasses should implement this method and return a modified version of the current match. The returned string will be used as a replacement string for Matcher.appendReplacement(StringBuffer, String), with the syntax described in the javadoc for that method. So backslashes and dollar signs may need to be escaped.

        If the match is not actually correct, null can be returned. (This can be used with the default applyTo without creating an infinite loop.)

        Note: Macros may add new macros to the end of the macro list (e.g., by creating new macros), but other modifications to the list may not be supported.

        Specified by:
        modify in class Macro
        Parameters:
        code - the user code on which this macro is being applied.
        match - a match of this macro's pattern.
        Returns:
        the replacement of the matched region, or null if the match is not actually valid.

      • includeInAlgorithm

        public java.lang.String includeInAlgorithm()
        Specified by:
        includeInAlgorithm in class Macro
